videos.name: Defold Installation and Overview
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: In this session you’ll learn about how to install Defold on your desktop (Mac or Windows) as well as get oriented to the Defold Editor.

videos.name: Defold Image Procedures
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This session will provide instructions on how to load images to your Defold game project as well as how to position them within your game.  Some basic animation techniques are also described.

videos.name: Defold Drag and Drop
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: A walkthough is provided on how you can support a user selecting a specific game object and dragging it to a new location within your game.

videos.name: Defold Movement
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This tutorial describes the procedures needed to move a Game Object using either a pre-defined path, or based on user inputs via mouse or touch.

videos.name: Defold Physics
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: Leveraging Defold’s Physics Engine – this tutorial reviews the concept of a collision object, used to trigger when one game object touches another, effects of gravity and bounce features.

videos.name: Defold GUI
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: A detailed description is provided on how you can incorporate button animations within the GUI as well as text notifications to users.

videos.name: Defold Levels and Lua Modules
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: The final tutorial in this introductory series provides an explanation on how to accommodate multiple game levels to support different scenes or game chapters – as well as how to exchange information between game components.

videos.name: Series Introduction
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: This game programming series by Game from Scratch covers covers all aspects of 2D game development in Defold. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Getting Started
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this part of our ongoing Defold Tutorial Series, we look at the initial getting started process. We download and run the tools, create then run our first project. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Application Basics
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: Welcome to the second tutorial in the Defold Game Engine series by Game from Scratch. Today we look at how a Defold application works. How collections, game objects and components are used together to create games. We then look at attaching a script and how the game lifecycle is resolved. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Sprites and Animations
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this part of the tutorial we look at creating flipbook style sprite animations. We look at the two ways it is supported, Atlas based and tilesheet based sprites. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Input, Scripting and Messages
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In the next part of our ongoing Defold Game Engine tutorial, we look at how you script. In addition we look at handling input and how message passing works, a critical concept. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Sound and Music
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this part of the Defold Game Engine tutorial series we are going to look at audio programming. Specifically how to play ogg and wav files using components and code. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Tilemaps
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this tutorial we look at quickly and easily creating 2D levels using the Defold editor and tile maps. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Physics
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this tutorial on using the Defold Game Engine, we explore how to use the integrated Box2D physics. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: UI Programming
videos.author: Game from Scratch
videos.description: In this tutorial we look at GUI/UI programming in the Defold game engine. DISCLAIMER: This tutorial series shows the old editor and website. The new website does not require any login and account setup to create a project.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Opening Sequence
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This Tower Defense Tutorial will teach you the basics on how to incorporate the following features into a game: (1) splashscreens, (2) level selection menus, (3) help screens, (4) tank strikes, (5) tower placement, (6) fire exchange, (7) health resources, and (8) victory conditions.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Tanks and Objectives
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This second video in our Tower Defense Series will focus on the design of Tank Collections and a Game Object representing the Enemy Tank's Final Objective.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Tower Deployment
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: Hang on for this third video in our Tower Defense Series – it focuses on game design techniques that facilitate the spawning of both Defensive Positions and Tower Collections, as well as supporting the ability to drag and drop Tower Objects across the game screen.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Fire Exchange
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: You just can’t have a Tower Defense game with modeling the exchange of gun fires between your deployed Towers…and the series of Tank Strikes that move toward their objective.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Scoring and Tower Upgrade Process
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This fifth video in our Tower Defense Series will focus on design mechanics that support the inclusion of both a Resource as well as Health set of Scoring criteria. Additionally, it will address the addition of a popup that will let you either repair a tower, upgrade a tower or sell it outright.

videos.name: Build a Tower Defense game - Game Pause and Tutorial Wrap-up
videos.author: Tactx Studios
videos.description: This last video in our Tower Defense Series is going to focus on a couple pretty important concepts: (1) pausing a game using the Defold Collection Proxy Component, and (2) adjusting several game parameters within the game to achieve game balance.

videos.name: Lua Tutorial
videos.author: Derek Bananas
videos.description: Learn Lua in one hour.

videos.name: Lua in 100 seconds
videos.author: Fireship
videos.description: An overview of the Lua language.

videos.name: Scrolling background
videos.author: Mahri2D
videos.description: How to create a scrolling background.

videos.name: Top Down Movement
videos.author: Mahri2D
videos.description: How to create a top-down player movement controller.

videos.name: Follow mouse
videos.author: Mahri2D
videos.description: How to make an object follow the mouse pointer or finger.

videos.name: Rotate to mouse
videos.author: Mahri2D
videos.description: How to make an object rotate towards the mouse pointer or finger.

videos.name: Introduction to Defold
videos.author: Game Developers
videos.description: In this first lesson, we are going over the game engine IDE, its main blocks and its capabilities as engine to create multiplatform games.

videos.name: Creating a platformer protoype
videos.author: Game Developers
videos.description: In this video, we will start to take a look at the building blocks of creating a game for the engine.

videos.name: Enemy movement and animations
videos.author: Game Developers
videos.description: In this video, we are implementing an enemy with a basic behavior of walking forward until colliding with a wall and then flipping into the opposite direction. We will add animations to the enemy and to the player that was implemented in the previous video.

videos.name: Enemy melee attack
videos.author: Game Developers
videos.description: In this video, we are continuing from the previous video and build a detect and attack behavior for our skeleton enemy. For this to work, we have to implement trigger detection, collision enabling and disabling, frame count detection to synchronize the hitbox enabling with the frame animation, and finally applying the damage to the player.

videos.name: Procedural 2D Terrain with Climate
videos.author: Sergey Lerg
videos.description: Procedural 2D terrain generation with procedural climate change animation using Defold engine and Lua programming language.

videos.name: AdMob extension for Defold
videos.author: Sergey Lerg
videos.description: How to use AdMob in Defold.

videos.name: Taxi Town and Lunar Orbit - Technical breakdown
videos.author: Sergey Lerg
videos.description: A Technical breakdown of how Taxi Town and Lunar Orbit were created using Defold.

videos.name: Grids and Arrays
videos.author: Sergey Lerg
videos.description: Tutorial on making grids and working with arrays in Defold.

videos.name: Cellular Automata and Procedural Map Generation
videos.author: Klayton Kowalski
videos.description: In this video, Klayton explain what a cellular automaton is, how it works, and how to implement it.

videos.name: Diamond Square and Procedural Map Generation
videos.author: Klayton Kowalski
videos.description: In this video, Klayton explain what a cellular automaton is, how it works, and how to implement it.

videos.name: Cellular Automata and Procedural Map Generation
videos.author: Klayton Kowalski
videos.description: In this video, Klayton explain what the diamond square algorithm is, how it works, and how to implement it.

videos.name: Lazy Flood Fill and Procedural Map Generation
videos.author: Klayton Kowalski
videos.description: In this video, Klayton explain what the lazy flood fill algorithm algorithm is, how it works, and how to implement it.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #1 - Collection Proxies and memory management
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain how to better design scene and level loading in your game? How does Defold manage memory under the hood?

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #2 - App Manifest in Defold and the manifestation tool
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain how to use an app manifest to reduce the size of your game.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #3 - The basics of addressing and message passing
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain the concept of message passing and the basics of game object addressing.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #4 - How to add post effects to a Defold game
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: How to modify the rendering pipeline of Defold. Overview of the render script, Shaders, materials and how to modify them. Implementing a full screen post effect.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #5 - Talking to objects created by Collection Factories
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain addressing in the context of factory created game objects and in nested collections. We also discuss the performance of message passing.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #6 - Why Live Update is essential for your game
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain what Live Update is and how to use it.

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #7 - Constructing and deconstructing URLs, caching senders
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: How are message URLs constructed and what are the parts that make up a full URL to an object in Defold?

videos.name: Defold Team Explains #8 - How to push new content to live games
videos.author: Defold
videos.description: In this video we explain how to use Live Update to push new content to live games.

videos.name: How To Make a Hyper Casual Game - Square Fall Tutorial Part 1
videos.author: ShapeShift Games
videos.description: This is a four part tutorial for making a simple hyper casual game called Square Fall. In part 1 you will create the project and do some initial setup (11 steps).

videos.name: How To Make a Hyper Casual Game - Square Fall Tutorial Part 2
videos.author: ShapeShift Games
videos.description: This is a four part tutorial for making a simple hyper casual game called Square Fall. In part 2 you will create the start screen (9 steps).

videos.name: How To Make a Hyper Casual Game - Square Fall Tutorial Part 3
videos.author: ShapeShift Games
videos.description: This is a four part tutorial for making a simple hyper casual game called Square Fall. In part 3 you will create the fully functioning game (35 steps).

videos.name: How To Make a Hyper Casual Game - Square Fall Tutorial Part 4
videos.author: ShapeShift Games
videos.description: This is a four part tutorial for making a simple hyper casual game called Square Fall. Part 4 is the final video. In this part you will create the gameover screen (11 steps).

tutorials.name: Side scroller
tutorials.description: This tutorial is intended to give a taste of what making games in Defold is about. It goes through creating a new project, based on a simple side-scroller. You will then learn how to tweak the game to make it more fun. Finally you will add a new game object. The tutorial should only take about 10 minutes.

tutorials.name: Walking astronaut
tutorials.description: In this beginner's tutorial you learn how to capture player input and make a character move and animate. You will also learn about game objects, components and collections.

tutorials.name: Movement
tutorials.description: In this beginner's tutorial you learn how to make realistic movement using vectors and some simple vector algebra.

tutorials.name: Colorslide
tutorials.description: In this medium difficulty tutorial you build an in-game GUI, a GUI screen for level selection and a start screen for a simple multi level mobile game.

tutorials.name: War battles
tutorials.description: In this tutorial you will create the embryo of a small shooter game. This is a good starting point if you are new to Defold.

tutorials.name: Snake
tutorials.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you to get started with script logic together with a few of the building blocks in Defold.

tutorials.name: 15 puzzle
tutorials.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you to lab with a few of the building blocks in Defold and run script logic.

tutorials.name: Shadertoy
tutorials.description: In this tutorial you will convert a shader from shadertoy.com to Defold.

tutorials.name: Runner
tutorials.description: In this tutorial you start with an empty project and build a complete runner game with an animated character, physics collision, pickups and scoring.

tutorials.name: Magic link
tutorials.description: In this tutorial you will build a complete little puzzle game with a start screen, the mechanics of the game and simple level progression in the form of increasing difficulty.

tutorials.name: Building a car
tutorials.description: If you are new to Defold, this guide will help you getting your bearings right in the editor. It also explains the basic ideas and the most common building blocks in Defold - game objects, collections, scripts and sprites.

tutorials.name: Creating online games using Nakama and Defold
tutorials.description: In this tutorial we will look at how to create online multiplayer games in Defold using the open-source Nakama game server from Heroic Labs.

tutorials.name: Releasing HTML5 games on Yandex.Games
tutorials.description: In this blog post we’ll look at how to add the Yandex.Games SDK to a Defold game and how to submit your game to the Yandex.Games catalog.

tutorials.name: Releasing HTML5 games on Game Distribution
tutorials.description: In this blog post we'll look at how to add the Game Distribution SDK to an existing game or how to create one from scratch. We will also look at how to submit your game for distribution through the Game Distribution network.

tutorials.name: Shaders for Beginners
tutorials.description: In this guest tutorial Paweł Jarosz, developer of Witchcrafter: Empire Legends, share his experience learning shader programming in general and for Defold in particular.

tutorials.name: Color grading
tutorials.description: In this tutorial you will create a full screen post effect in Defold.

tutorials.name: Tactx Studios tutorials
tutorials.description: These tutorials illustrate several common features of the Defold Game Engine, to include: (a) Image Procedures, (b) Dragging and Dropping Game Objects, (c) various Game Object Movement Techniques, (d) Preliminary use of 2d Physics based Collisions, (e) Graphic User Interface (GUI), and (f) an introduction to Defold Levels, Messaging and Menu Development.

tutorials.name: Lights and Shadows
tutorials.description: This sample project shows how to achieve pixel perfect shadows in a 2D view.

tutorials.name: Pixel Line Platformer
tutorials.description: This sample project shows how to create a platformer game using original art created by Kenney.

tutorials.name: Asteroids
tutorials.description: This is a very simple 'Asteroids' clone where you turn the ship left and right with the arrow keys and fire at incoming meteors with space.

tutorials.name: Linker
tutorials.description: This sample project shows how to create a linker game. Click and drag and link three or more fish of the same color together to remove them from the board. Long chains of fish yields boosters.

tutorials.name: Shadertoy
tutorials.description: This sample project shows how to port a Shadertoy shader to to Defold.

tutorials.name: RPG Map
tutorials.description: This sample shows one method of creating very large screen based RPG maps in Defold.

tutorials.name: Platformer
tutorials.description: In this article, you go through the implementation of a basic tile-based 2D platformer in Defold. The mechanics you learn are moving left/right, jumping and falling.

tutorials.name: Main menu (OLD)
tutorials.description: In this sample, you learn effects to present a main menu.

tutorials.name: Parallax (OLD)
tutorials.description: In this sample, you learn how to use a parallax effect to simulate depth in the game world.

tutorials.name: Hud (OLD)
tutorials.description: In this sample, you learn effects for score counting.

tutorials.name: Level complete (OLD)
tutorials.description: In this sample, you learn effects to show the score counting that could occur when a level has been completed.
